education.degree: Master of Science in Robotics: Human-Robot Interaction, Perception, AI
B.A.Sc. in Mechanical Engineering: AI, Robotics, Mechatronics, Manufacturing

experience.title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence Teaching Assistant
responsibilities: Supported a class of 2000+ students by managing student communication pipelines and coordinating logistics across multiple platforms
Designed and reviewed coding assignments, quizzes, and exams to align with core AI concepts and ensure fairness and clarity
Conducted code reviews and provided structured feedback to enhance student understanding of algorithmic implementation and debugging

experience.title: Robotics Engineer
responsibilities: Designed and implemented autonomous mobile robot (AMR) and automated guided vehicle (AGV) solutions to improve warehouse automation, material handling, and operational efficiency
Built and deployed SLAM-based navigation and perception systems for AMRs, leveraging industry-standard tools to enable robust, real-time autonomous operation in dynamic warehouse environments

experience.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning Teaching Assistant
responsibilities: Led and coordinated a team of 6 teaching assistants to strategically plan and design coursework deliverables, ensuring that all tasks met key deadlines and project milestones
Collaborated with faculty to design course modules, completing curriculum development 2 days ahead of schedule

Streamlined communication channels for 130+ students and staff by implementing documentation protocols and efficient discussion platforms, significantly improving organizational clarity and responsiveness

experience.title: SLAM and Navigation Researcher
responsibilities: Implemented and tested modules for visual-inertial SLAM pipelines on mobile robots, focusing on ORB-based feature extraction and semantic map integration using deep learning models

Developed a semantic navigation framework incorporating a vision-language model (VLM) to generate language-guided actions, enabling intuitive and socially-aware human-robot interaction in dynamic environments
Led hardware troubleshooting and sensor calibration on TurtleBot4 platform, streamlining data pipelines and connectivity to ensure reliable real-time performance and system robustness
Publication: Yi Lian, J. Taery Kim, Sehoon Ha, “Implicit Behavioral Cues for Enhancing Trust and Comfort in Robot Social Navigation,” ICRA 2025 PTAS Workshop (Best Presentation Award)

experience.title: Machine Learning Engineer
responsibilities: Designed and deployed LSTM-based deep learning models for bandwidth prediction in large-scale computer networks, achieving a prediction error below 5%
Streamlined data acquisition pipelines with socket programming and network emulators (Mahimahi, NS2), improving real-time ingestion across 60% of team projects
Resolved synchronization issues and enhanced data integrity in Django-based clustered databases, enabling reliable deployment of ML-based congestion control systems

Publications:
  • Ahmed Elbery, Yi Lian, and Geng Li, “Toward Fair and Efficient Congestion Control: Machine Learning Aided Congestion Control (MLACC),” APNET ’23, 2023, doi:10.1145/3600061.3603275
  • Sina Keshvadi, Shuihai Hu, Yi Lian, Geng Li, “OpenData: A Framework to Train and Deploy ML Solutions in Wide-Area Networks,” IEEE Network, 2023, doi:10.1109/MNET.2023.3320929

projects.name: PHARMore, Data Mining for Drug Discovery
details: Developed an integrated application that automatically extracts drug mentions and metadata from research papers (PDF/URL), achieving a 92% extraction accuracy on benchmark datasets.
Engineered a recommendation engine using NLP and public biomedical databases to deliver drug similarity suggestions, improving recommendation precision by 20%.
Deployed a chatbot powered by the Google Gemini API on AWS via Streamlit, reducing research data processing time by 35% and streamlining drug repurposing workflows.

projects.name: HINTeract, Interactive Robot Learning Framework
details: Trained Behavioral Cloning policies from 260+ demonstrations for subtask-level table assembly in Robosuite.
Built a hierarchical imitation learning framework with hint-guided feedback, optimizing sample efficiency and task rollout stability.

projects.name: SpooderMan, Autonomous Robot Follower
details: Developed an autonomous robot follower on TurtleBot3 by employing SIFT-based feature extraction and image segmentation using OpenCV and custom ROS2 packages

Integrated a SLAM framework with a dynamic window-based controller for precise global localization and coordinate-based navigation, enabling efficient maze traversal through KNN-based directional sign classification

projects.name: Oogway, Autonomous Rover and Robot Companion
details: Developed a SLAM system on TurtleBot 2 using SURF-based feature detection, enabling reliable recognition and tracking of over five distinct objects in a maze environment with ROS, gmapping, and OpenCV.
Integrated object-following and emotion-display modules that resulted in an 80% user satisfaction rating, improving the system's responsiveness and user engagement.

projects.name: Kir-B, Autonomous Maze-Navigating Rover
details: Designed an Arduino-based autonomous maze-navigating rover, achieving a top 3 ranking for autonomy in competition.

Developed and integrated modules for obstacle avoidance, localization, object detection, and communication, enabling efficient sensor data transfer from Arduino Mega via Bluetooth and high-level command processing in Python.
Improved localization accuracy by 70% through advanced sensor data preprocessing and the implementation of a particle filter algorithm.

projects.name: Driver Drowsiness Detector, Real-time Drowsiness Detection
details: Designed and trained a convolutional neural network (CNN) in PyTorch for high-accuracy driver drowsiness detection (98.9%), with real-time facial feature extraction from video frames using OpenCV.
Implemented a bounding box system for precise feature detection, achieving reliable monitoring in live video scenarios.
